meanings.definition: A prickly seed case or pod that sticks to clothing or fur.
meanings.sent1: The burs from the plant got stuck on my socks during the hike.
meanings.sent2: I had to carefully remove the burs from my dog's fur after our walk.
meanings.sent3: The burs played a game of 'catch me if you can' with my sweater.
meanings.sent4: The burs clung to the fabric like tiny hitchhikers on a journey.
meanings.sent5: The burs were like nature's Velcro, attaching themselves to anything fuzzy.

meanings.definition: A small, flat, thin piece of metal used to join two parts of a garment.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a shiny burs onto the torn seam of her dress.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully selected the right burs to fix the button on the coat.
meanings.sent3: The burs on the dress seemed to whisper, 'We'll keep you together.'
meanings.sent4: The burs acted as tiny bridges, connecting the fabric seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The burs were like magical metal stickers, holding the clothing pieces in place.

meanings.definition: A pouch or sac in the body, especially one containing fluid.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the burs to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: The burs in the knee help to reduce friction between bones.
meanings.sent3: The burs in the body are like tiny water balloons, protecting the joints.
meanings.sent4: The burs functioned as cushions, preventing the bones from rubbing together.
meanings.sent5: The burs were like secret fluid-filled pockets, silently supporting the body's movements.
